SENT.plain: A patient with intravascular coagulation caused by the Klippel-Trenaunay syndrome is presented; this is a rare phenomenon
The patient was treated with fast electrons
Sonography is a suitable method for determining the extension of the haemangiomas occurring in Klippel-Trenaunay's syndrome
This is important for therapy planning
With colour-coded Doppler sonography, arteriovenous fistulas can be ruled out, this allowing to distinguish the Klippel-Trenaunay syndrome from the Parkes-Weber syndrome
